actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide a more graduated tax rate for corporations.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to reduce the corporate tax rate schedule to read as follows: (1) 17 percent of taxable income which does not exceed $50,000 (currently $25,000); (2) 20 percent of such income between $50,000 and $100,000 (currently between $25,000 and $50,000); (3) 30 percent of such income between $100,000 and $150,000 (currently between $50,000 and $75,000); (4) 40 percent of such income between $150,000 and $200,000 (currently between $75,000 and $100,000); and (5) 46 percent of the excess over $200,000.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide a more graduated tax rate for corporations.
